name: SalesOrders_GetItemAsync_typeorderId
description:
The expand query parameter corresponds to sections in the Visma.net.ERP.SalesOrders.Api.Dto.SalesOrder.SalesOrderDto.
If an expand value is not specified it will not be filled and returned in the response object.
            
Sample request:
            
`GET /salesorders/SO/000100?expand=customer,payment`

type.description: The type of sales order to get

orderId.description: The id of the sales order to get

expand.description: An optional specification of what details to include about the sales order. The default value if not supplied is "None"

SalesOrderExpansions.description: The Visma.net.ERP.SalesOrders.Api.Dto.SalesOrderExpansions enumeration defines individual parts of the Visma.net.ERP.SalesOrders.Api.Dto.SalesOrder.SalesOrderDto that can be filled

$ul: **overridesDefault**: Whether this address overrides the default address
**email**: The e-mail address of the contact
**fax**: The fax number of the contact
**overridesDefault**: Whether this overrides the default contact
**phone1**: The phone number of the contact
**phone2**: The secondary phone number of the contact
**cancelBy**: The cancel date for the order
**createdBy**: The user name of the creator of the order. If the order was created by an API call this field will be null or empty.
**contactId**: The contact id for the customer
**id**: The unique id of the the customer
**internalId**: An internal unique id of the customer
**corporateId**: The corporate id of the location
**countryId**: The country code of the location
**gln**: The global localization number of the location
**internalId**: An internal id of the customer location
**taxRegistrationId**: The tax registration id of the location
**warehouseId**: The site id of the location
**cashDiscountDate**: The date for the cash discount
**dueDate**: The due date for the invoice
**invoiceId**: The id of the invoice issued for the order
**invoiceSeparately**: Whether the order should be invoiced separately
**postPeriod**: The post period for the invoice
**amount**: The amounts calculated based on the ship terms.
**amountInBaseCurrency**: The amounts calculated based on the ship terms in base currency of the order.
**cost**: The freight cost calculated for the sales order,
**costInBaseCurrency**: The freight cost calculated for the sales order in base currency.
**premiumAmount**: The additional freight charges for handling the order.
**premiumAmountInBaseCurrency**: The additional freight charges in base currency for handling the order.
**taxCategoryId**: The tax category that applies to the freight amount.
**isRotRutDeductable**: Whether the order is ROT/RUT deductible
**lastModified**: Date the order was last modified
**orderId**: The unique identifier of the order
**orderQty**: The total quantity of inventory items in the order
**orderId**: The unique id of the origin order
**orderType**: The order type code for the origin order
**originalOrderId**: The unique identifier of the original order
**originalOrderType**: The type code for the original sales order
**internalId**: The internal unique identifier of the employee
**descriptionOnInvoice**: Set to true to print description on the invoice
**noteOnExternalDocuments**: Set to true to print note on external documents
**noteOnInternalDocuments**: Set to true to print note on internal documents
**project**: The Visma.net.ERP.SalesOrders.Api.Dto.ProjectDto class defines a project reference for a sales order
**internalId**: An internal unique identifier of the project
**overridesDefault**: Whether this address overrides the default address
**email**: The e-mail address of the contact
**fax**: The fax number of the contact
**overridesDefault**: Whether this overrides the default contact
**phone1**: The phone number of the contact
**phone2**: The secondary phone number of the contact
**insurance**: Whether insurance applies to this shipping
**saturdayDelivery**: Whether this is a saturday delivery
**shipSeparately**: Whether this order can/is shipped separately
**cancelled**: Whether this order is in a cancelled state
**description**: The status code for the order
**hold**: Whether this order is in a held state
**costTotal**: The total of the costs on the lines of the sales order. How the `costTotal` is calculated is dependent on the option `useReplacementCostForMarginAndProfit`.
**costTotalInBaseCurrency**: The total of the costs on the lines of the sales order in base currency.
**discountTotalInBaseCurrency**: The discount total in base currency
**freightCost**: The freight cost calculated for the sales order. Not applicable for transfer order types.
**freightCostInBaseCurrency**: The freight cost calculated for the sales order in base currency. Not applicable for transfer order types.
**freightTotal**: The freight amount calculated in accordance with the shipping terms. Not applicable for transfer order types.
**freightTotalInBaseCurrency**: The freight amount calculated in accordance with the shipping terms in base currency. Not applicable for transfer order types.
**orderTotalInBaseCurrency**: The order total in base currency
**taxExemptTotalInBaseCurrency**: The VAT exempt total in base currency
**taxTotalInBaseCurrency**: The tax total in base currency
**taxableTotalInBaseCurrency**: The VAT taxable in base currency
**unbilledAmount**: The sum of unbilled amounts for the lines
**unbilledAmountInBaseCurrency**: The sum of unbilled amounts for the lines in base currency
**unshippedAmount**: The sum of unshipped amounts for the lines
**unshippedAmountInBaseCurrency**: The sum of unshipped amounts for the lines in base currency
**type**: The type code for the sales order
**useReplacementCostForMarginAndProfit**: When this option is set to `true`, the `costTotal` of the order will be calculated based on `replacementUnitCost`.
**version**: An internal order version used for detecting concurrent updates to an order
